data.text:
John Robert Mazer, 77, of Watkinsville, passed away at home surrounded by family on July 28, 2024. Born on April 27, 1947, he was the son of the late Dr. Mendel Mazer and Lillian Cohen Mazer.

John graduated from Yale University in 1969 and retired from a 30+ year career at Georgia Pacific. He was a very active individual and had many hobbies including cycling, walking, gardening, traveling, photography, and newspaper crossword puzzles. He was a past president of Congregation Children of Israel and took pride teaching Sunday School there for many years. He enjoyed a cup of Black English tea every morning and loved to spend time in his yard watching the wildlife.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his brother Dr. Fred Mazer; and many canine companions, particularly his beloved walking partner, Bosie.

Survivors include his wife of 44 years Debra Mazer; children, Jesse MacKenzie (Douglas), Samantha Alex (Willice); siblings, Linda Goldman, Mike Mazer; many nieces and nephews.

A memorial service will be held on Thursday, August 1, 2024, at 3:00 PM at the Congregation Children of Israel. In lieu of flowers, please make a donation to the State Botanical Garden of Georgia, where he was a dedicated volunteer.

Lord & Stephens Funeral Home, EAST, Athens is entrusted with arrangements. www.lordandstephens.com
